resources.string: Click on the buttons below for help on those subjects.

To create an account, click the register button on the top of the screen. Fill in your name, email address and a password that you want to use for your new account. You can use any email address but if you use a Thales address you will be able to create your own events. Accounts with other email addresses will only be able to join existing events.\n\nIf you\'re done filling in your details, press OK and you will be logged in automatically.

If you want to join an event, click on it first. This will show 3 buttons:
 - More Details: Will show you more information on the event like: a description, what time the event will be, the location of the event and the minimum and maximum amount of participants.
 - People Currently Signed Up: Shows a list of people who participate in the event, if any.
 - Sign Up: Pressing this will sign you up for an event. If you are already signed up, this will show as a Sign Out button.

To create an event you must have a Thales account. You will automatically get a Thales account if you used your Thales email address when creating your account.\n\nIf you press the plus symbool on the top of the screen you will go to the event creation screen. Simply fill in all the fields and press the OK button on the top of the screen. Your event will now show up in the Events tab.

If you want to edit your account details, go to the navigation drawer by clicking on the right of the top bar or by swiping from the left side of your screen to the right. Click on Profile.\n\nHere you can change your name and password by clicking the edit icon on the right. You can also change your profile picture by clicking on the current profile picture.

If you want to filter events, locations or people on certain things, click the magnifying glass at the top of the screen. On this screen you can add or remove filters. If for example you add the filter name \"contains abc\" and go back to the list, you will only find events, locations or people where the name contains abc.\n\nYou can add as many filters as you want. The current filters will be shown below the create button. You can remove filters by clicking the red x to the right of it. Your last-used filters are automatically saved and loaded, even if you quit the app completely.
